meanings.definition: Lack of clarity or sharpness in appearance or sound.
meanings.sent1: The indistinctness of the photo made it hard to see who was in it.
meanings.sent2: The fog created an indistinctness that obscured the view of the mountains.
meanings.sent3: The indistinctness of the painting made it look like a blurry mess.
meanings.sent4: Her memory of that day had an indistinctness that made it hard to recall details.
meanings.sent5: The indistinctness of the music made it feel like a distant echo.

meanings.definition: The quality of being not easily distinguishable or recognizable.
meanings.sent1: The indistinctness of the twins confused their classmates.
meanings.sent2: The camouflage jacket blended in with the forest due to its indistinctness.
meanings.sent3: The indistinctness of the flavors in the dish left the chef puzzled.
meanings.sent4: The indistinctness of the voices on the phone call made it hard to identify the caller.
meanings.sent5: The indistinctness of the logo made it difficult to recognize the brand.
